name: cartage
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the transporting of goods by road, usually over short distances: I know where I can get some broken slabs. I'll only have to pay him a pound and the cartage.
More examplesFewer examplesContractors employed to collect and cart away road debris often deposited their sweepings down gullies, thus saving themselves the cost of cartage. Cartage is the collection or delivery of goods by road from a warehouse, goods depot, airport, seaport, etc.Road cartage by ox wagon added to costs and to the risk of accidental spillage.Shearing, cartage and sale costs often amount to more than farmers receive for their wool.
